summary: Build a cute/girly self-care web app with dark mode, to-do list, notes saved locally, self-care reminder notifications, daily quote, and a relaxing bubble pop mini-game.
architectural_notes: Use localStorage to persist the notes textarea content.
Use browser Notification API (request permission on load; send notifications when permitted).
Dark mode implemented by toggling a .dark class and using CSS variables for theme colors.
Bubble game uses timed DOM element creation/removal (setInterval + setTimeout) and plays an audio pop on click.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page "Girly Self Care" app UI with a card-based layout that includes sections for: Dark mode toggle, To-Do List, Notes, Self-Care Reminders, Daily Quote, and a Bubble Pop mini-game.

Implement a cute, coherent visual theme inspired by the provided design: pastel pink background, white cards, rounded corners, soft shadows, and a primary button color matching the theme. Use Tailwind CSS for styling and keep typography consistent across the page.
Add a dark mode toggle that switches between light and dark themes using CSS variables (or Tailwind theme equivalents) and a single class toggle on the page root (e.g., body or app wrapper).
Implement the To-Do List: allow adding tasks from an input; display tasks in a list; allow marking a task complete by clicking/tapping it (rendered with strikethrough styling).

Implement the Notes section with a multiline text area and a Save action that persists the note to localStorage and shows a confirmation message in English (e.g., "Saved"). On page load, prefill the note from localStorage if present.

Implement Self-Care Reminders using the browser Notification API: request permission when appropriate, provide preset reminder buttons (Water, Hair, Exercise, Self-Care), and trigger a notification with the provided messages when permission is granted.
Display a Daily Quote section that randomly selects and shows one quote from the provided preset list each time the page loads.

Add a relaxing Bubble Pop mini-game area: spawn bubble elements periodically within a fixed-height playfield; clicking/tapping a bubble removes it and plays a pop sound from the provided audio URL; auto-remove bubbles after a short timeout.

Update the React app UI to follow the provided HTML app flow with in-app navigation between these views: (1) Opening screen with a greeting and a “Next” button, (2) Menu screen with buttons to open To-Do List, Self-Care Reminders, Notes, and Relax Mode, and (3) One dedicated screen per feature with a clear “Back” action returning to the Menu.

Add background ambient music to the app using the provided audio URL, with a user control to play/pause (and optionally mute/unmute) that works with modern browser autoplay restrictions and persists the user’s preference locally.
Align the app’s copy (headings, button labels, placeholders, and short helper text) to match the provided HTML app’s wording and structure while keeping all user-facing text in English.
Parse and implement the complete HTML app structure from the user-provided source code, preserving all sections, styling patterns, and interaction behaviors defined in the original markup
Apply the Comic Sans MS font family as specified in the HTML source to maintain the cute, friendly aesthetic throughout the app
Implement the gradient background using the exact colors from the HTML source: linear gradient from #ffc0cb (pink) to #ff99cc (hot pink) from top-left to bottom-right
Implement the section display logic from the HTML source where sections are hidden by default (display:none) and shown individually based on navigation state
Extract and implement all interactive features, content, and user flows defined in the complete HTML source code that was truncated in the user message
